repnme.cdata!:
Republic of Yemen - Sana'a Emergency
            Power Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings are as follows: Project
            outcome is satisfactory; sustainability is likely;
            institutional development impact is modest; Bank performance
            is unsatisfactory; and Borrower performance is
            unsatisfactory. The following lessons of broader relevance
            emerge from the experience of this project: 1) The Bank
            should be very cautious in pursuing experimental or
            innovative solutions to institutional problems in small
            countries with little potential for attracting foreign
            investors and with limited capacity to design, negotiate and
            supervise complex contractual arrangements with private
            investors. 2) The Bank should have been more proactive in
            the gas sector, given the close interdependency between gas
            and power. The macroeconomic loss to Yemen from almost a
            decade's delay in developing its gas resources for
            power generation (independent of any other losses from
            non-utilization of gas in other sectors and/or exports) runs
            into hundreds of millions of dollars. The Bank could have
            done a better job in advising and assisting the Government
            to expedite gas development for power independently of the
            export schemes for liquefied natural gas that the Government
            was primarily interested in. 3) Energy loss reduction and
            capacity building programs should always be included in
            Bank's power projects seeking to improve the
            performance of power utilities. They are often slow to yield
            results but there is no substitute for institutional
            strengthening in order to achieve better utility
            performance. In the case of this project, a diagnosis of the
            Public Electricity Corporation's weakness with no
            provision for addressing them was clearly inadequate. 4)
            State support to oil refining should not impose unreasonable
            burdens on the electric power sector and should be dealt
            with separately from power sector finances.

repnme.cdata!:
Yemen - Sana'a Emergency Power Project
            : environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The Sana'a Emergency Power Project
            will consist of three inter-related components:
            rehabilitation/upgrading activities for the existing
            diesel-fuelled power plant at Dhahban site; installation of
            additional generating capacity at the existing site; and,
            expansion/upgrading of the Asser sub-station, including
            elements to avoid transmission congestion in the existing
            network. During construction and operation, mitigation
            measures will include: 1) On the effects of oil spillage, a
            new simple oil/water system for handling discharged oil
            polluted waste-waters, will replace the old spillway system.
            Spill trays at "hot spots" will be installed for
            handling oil polluted soil, and oily water during
            construction. 2) During operation, the stack height for the
            power plants will be increased to control air quality. 3)
            Internal and external noise abatement measures will be
            ensured, to include partial insulation in buildings, and,
            provide hearing protection devices. 4) Overall working
            conditions should be improved in cooperation with the
            Department of Public Health and Safety. Contingency plans
            will include fire and emergency procedures. 6) The
            construction company will be instructed to use
            archaeological "chance find" procedures, if
            encountered with such sites during construction. It is
            proposed to include consultancy assistance to secure the
            environmental mitigation measures.

docna.cdata!:
Yemen - Sana'a Emergency Power Project
            : environmental assessment

display_title.display_title:
Yemen - Sana'a Emergency
            Power Project : environmental assessment
